Helm.name: Normal Galea
Helm.description: A standard Roman military helmet made of bronze or iron, worn by ordinary legionaries. It protected the head and neck during combat.

Helm.name: Officer Galea
Helm.description: A Roman helmet worn by centurions and other officers, often more ornate than the standard galea, featuring additional decorations such as crests and plumes to signify rank.

Helm.name: Legate Galea
Helm.description: A highly decorated helmet worn by legates (senior officers), often featuring elaborate designs and plumes to denote their high status and command position.

Helm.name: Gallic Helmet
Helm.description: A type of helmet used by Gallic warriors, often made of bronze or iron, featuring distinctive styles such as the 'Coolus' and 'Montefortino' designs adopted by the Romans.

Helm.name: Egyptian Helmet
Helm.description: A type of helmet used by Egyptian soldiers, often made of bronze and designed with a flared neck guard and cheek pieces for protection in battle.

Chest.name: Lorica Hamata
Chest.description: A type of chainmail armor used by Roman legionnaires, made of interlocking iron rings providing flexibility and protection.

Chest.name: Gallic Chainmail
Chest.description: Chainmail armor used by Gallic warriors, providing flexibility and good protection against slashing attacks.

Chest.name: Egyptian Scale Armor
Chest.description: Scale armor used by Egyptian soldiers, made of small metal scales sewn onto a fabric or leather backing, offering flexibility and protection.

Shield.name: Scutum
Shield.description: A large rectangular shield made of wood and covered with leather, often reinforced with metal. It was used to provide protection and form defensive formations like the testudo (tortoise).

Shield.name: Gallic Shield
Shield.description: A large, oval-shaped shield made of wood and covered with leather, often featuring distinctive designs and used by Gallic warriors for protection.

Shield.name: Egyptian Shield
Shield.description: A smaller, round or rectangular shield used by Egyptian soldiers, often made of wood and leather, designed for agility and protection in battle.

Weapons.name: Gladius
Weapons.description: A short sword with a broad, double-edged blade, used primarily for thrusting. It was the main weapon of Roman legionnaires.

Weapons.name: Pilum
Weapons.description: A type of heavy javelin designed to be thrown at the enemy. It had a long, thin iron shank and a pyramidal head, capable of penetrating armor and shields.

Weapons.name: Pugio
Weapons.description: A small dagger used by Roman soldiers as a secondary weapon. It was effective for close combat and as a utility tool.

Weapons.name: Gallic Long Sword
Weapons.description: A long sword used by Gallic warriors, known for its slashing capability and effectiveness in close combat.

Weapons.name: Gallic Spear
Weapons.description: A spear used by Gallic warriors, effective for both throwing and thrusting in battle.

Weapons.name: Khopesh
Weapons.description: A curved sword used by Egyptian soldiers, effective for slashing and hacking in close combat.

Weapons.name: Egyptian Spear
Weapons.description: A spear used by Egyptian soldiers, designed for both throwing and thrusting.

Legs.name: Caligae
Legs.description: Sturdy, heavy-soled military sandals with hobnailed soles, providing durability and traction for marching and combat.

Legs.name: Gallic Sandals
Legs.description: Leather sandals worn by Gallic warriors, providing mobility and comfort during battle.

Legs.name: Egyptian Sandals
Legs.description: Simple leather sandals worn by Egyptian soldiers, designed for comfort and mobility in the desert terrain.

Others.name: Gladius Sheath
Others.description: A sheath or scabbard used to protect and carry the gladius.

Others.name: Balteus
Others.description: A military belt worn by Roman soldiers, used to carry the gladius and other equipment.

Others.name: Focale
Others.description: A scarf worn around the neck to prevent chafing from the armor.

Others.name: Cingulum
Others.description: A military belt with metal fittings, often decorated and worn around the waist. It helped support the weight of the armor and weapons.

Others.name: Gallic Belt
Others.description: A leather belt worn by Gallic warriors, often decorated with metal fittings.

Others.name: Egyptian Belt
Others.description: A simple belt worn by Egyptian soldiers, used to secure their armor and carry weapons.
